lines.text: I'm not an idiot. I'm like an idiot savant, I just haven't found my savant yet.

[Playing the "Wuthering Heights" game with Rickie]
You have a go.
[Takes back the book]
Uh... Miss Bronte, uh...
MS. Bronte, MS. Bronte! Ms., you know, like Multiple Sclerosis.
Uh, Miss Bronte, uh, will I...
[pauses]
Will you what?
Uh, uh, uh, uh, get a fuck?
Oh, right. Same question. Okay.
[Closes her eyes, twirls her fingers and opens book to a random page]
Let's see. Uh, Ricky? It's a blank page. Sorry.
Oh, uh, there's nothing in the rules, like?
Is that eczema?
No, it's dermatitis.
Well, it's better than determine-itis which is what I've got.
[Slaps herself on her forehead]
Let's face it.
A woman's place is on my face.
Vagina. Nice place. Wouldn't want to live there.
This isn't a bordello you know, you can't just walk into any boudoir and choose a different bint!
I'll cook you some pasta, like the old days.
Living in the pasta.
I suppose on a clear day you can see the class struggle from here.

[Pretending to cough and choke]
An analogy to dust. Now, what could that be? God's dandruff, maybe.
Oh, I don't know. Where are you supposed to meet a man, you know, at 30?
Did you leave your Zimmer frame on the train?

[to Ricky at the pub]
Excuse me! Do you think your ample form has anything to do with the fact that you stuff your face? Or is it that you're not getting enough sex, may-be?
